snippet: The orchestra’s nod to Perle, who died in 2009, included “Transcendental Modulations” in a concert at Carnegie Hall.
abstract: James R Oestreich reviews American Symphony Orchestra concert honoring centenary of composer George Perle's birth, at Carnegie Hall.
lead_paragraph: The orchestra’s nod to Perle, who died in 2009, included “Transcendental Modulations” in a concert at Carnegie Hall.

headline.main: Review: American Symphony Orchestra’s George Perle Centennial Tribute
headline.print_headline: Hailing a Composer at the Century Mark, His Long-View Prospects in Mind
